item.title: EP 208 - RIP TERRENCE CRUTCHER & KEITH LAMONT SCOTT/NYC BOMBING/EMERGENCE OF A STICK MAN: BRAD PITT/SICK F*CKS OF THE WEEK/CAT KILLING ALLEGATIONS/NO GOOD JUDGE
item.description: In this Freestyle Friday while a whole lot to cover the Malachi Brothers, Michael Rapaport & Gerald Moody bring it to you RAW DOG WITHOUT A BAG. First we honor and speak on the innocent lives lost if Terrence Crutcher and Keith Lamont Scott and its effect on the nation. Unfortunately these slayings are part of a patterned epidemic that have been going on for decades. The bombing in NYC and how protests that turn to riots are helping D Trump in his run for the presidency even though his endorsement from Don King has us scratching our heads. We then enter the Fun & Games portion of the show as we discuss the emergence of Brad Pitt back into the single Stickman market, Sick F*cks of the Week, DeflateGate scientists publishing their findings, Cat Killing allegations against the Gringo Mandingo, Loaf Talk, another former NBA player on the verge of bankruptcy a No Good Judge segment and Gerald's solution for ending gang violence on the Southside of Chicago. This episode is not to be missed! To be a part of the I AM RAPAPORT League please visit www.DraftKings.com/iamrapaport. Create your own contests or Dance with the Dingo 1 on 1. item.title: EP 207 - FANTASY FOOTBALL FOLLIES 4 - BROUGHT TO YOU BY DRAFTKINGS: www.DRAFTKINGS.com/iamrapaport
item.description: Michael Rapaport aka the Fantasy Football JewRu is back to break down Week 2 action and who to look out for to keep you in the Win column for Week 3. We kick it off with the roller coaster ride that was Rapaport's Delight vs. Lisa Ann in the Howard Stern Fantasy Football League. Then we are giving shoutouts to those who went Head to Head against The Gringo Mandingo in the monkey cage. Some won and some lost but we danced. The thrill of victory and the agony of defeat with a whole lot of trash talking. Next we get into the NFL segment that's sweeping the nation "THAT'LL GET YA BENCHED". Finally we have a new segment that any serious Fantasy Football player needs to hear "THE DINGO BREAKS THE BANK" where the JewRu breaks down what players he likes in $ value per position at DraftKings. This episode is not to be missed! To be a part of the I AM RAPAPORT League please join www.DraftKings.com/iamrapaport. Create multiplayer contests or go Heads Up against The Gringo Mandingo to dance in the monkey cage. item.description: The Malachi Crunch does it again! Michael Rapaport aka The Albino Rhino and Gerald Moody aka The Black Ed McMahon bring it HARD BODY KARATE. First Michael kicks it solo to tell a harrowing tale about coming home to 2 dead cats floating in his fountain in front of his home. Gerald joins in with a very special announcement about his history and future. In this episode we're talking about Don King getting a street named in Cleveland, No Good Judges, Iman Shumpert's Rap Skills, J.R. Smith's Twitter beef with Revis Island, Antonio Cromartie's birthday calendar for his kids, DRose's civil suit, Franco Harris supporting Joe Paterno, Sick F*cks of the Week, Jimmy Fallon's DRUMP softball, Oakland PD being sued by a teenage prostitute and a plea to the owner of the Washington Redskins for them to change their name. This episode is not to be missed! To be a part of the I AM RAPAPORT League please visit www.DraftKings.com/iamrapaport. Create your own contests or Dance with the Dingo 1 on 1. item.description: Michael Rapaport aka The Gringo Mandingo sits down with the Fantasy Football Beast of the East, the West, The North and the South, ESPN's Matthew Berry. Michael and Matthew are arch rivals on the fantasy football field but off the gridiron it's nothing but love as they discuss how far fantasy football has come as a business, their Howard Stern League and Michael's growth as a player. Next we go over who stood out in NFL Week 1 (for better or for worse), who Michael likes and doesn't like for Week 2 in the NFL, how Michael did in primetime match ups in his 3 leagues along with the introduction of a new segment called "That'll get Ya Benched". This episode is not to be missed. item.title: EP 201 - ARE THERE BLACK PEOPLE IN BROOKLYN?/GUN HILL RD/THE PATRIOT WAY/EVOLUTION OF KAEPERNICK/KHLOE NBA FAMILY TREE/SICK F*CKS OTW/NO GOOD JUDGE
item.description: In this FLAMETHROWER of an episode Michael Rapaport aka The Gringo Mandingo and Gerald Moody aka GMoneti are face to face in the NYC Gloom Tomb. For the first time in 200 episode we lost some file fire due to a microphone going down from too much HEAT but in this RESURRECTION EP the I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST takes it to another level on the thermostat with No Facts Checked. We decide when the conversation is over Lena Dunham & Oddell Beckham Jr (we're coming for you both and Amy Schumer too). Bill Belicheck doesn't care about your fantasy football team. We like that Colin Kaepernick's stance is evolving and he's bringing attention to an important subject. All Loafs Matter with a true Unfolding aka Rope-a-Dope. Then we really turn up the heat about things that have us Red Hot: Sly Stallone having a Celebrity Death Hoax, Khloe Kardashian making her rounds around the NBA without taking into account retired players, Penn State about to honor Joe Paterno, Sick F*ck of the Week, Lyin' Brian Williams' new show, The Williams Sisters tennis tenacity, Aaron Rodgers being a human sleeping pill and a No Good Judge segment! Plus we preview our ALL STAR POTPOURRI PODCAST EP next week.This episode is not to be missed! item.title: EP 199 - HOWARD STERN FANTASY FOOTBALL LEAGUE RECAP EPISODE - FANTASY FOOTBALL FOLLIES 2 -PRESENTED BY DRAFTKINGS (PROMO CODE: RAPAPORT)
item.description: Michael Rapaport aka The Gringo Mandingo thought he was putting together a fantasy football team, he didn't know he was putting together an art project that would make Pablo Picasso blush. The day of days finally arrived. After an entire off season of preparation the 2016 HOWARD STERN FANTASY FOOTBALL DRAFT came upon us and this is the RECAP from the Captain of Rapaport's Delight. THIS IS SMASH MOUTH FANTASY FOOTBALL. THIS IS THE FANTASY FOOTBALL FOLLIES 2. Now a word from our Captain: "In this league it's 1 Point Per Reception. I had the third overall pick. 10. Hein 9. Barto 8. Jason 7. Will 6. JD 5. Gary 4. Scott 3. Rapaport 2. Lisa Ann 1. Berry 1 QB 2 RB 3 WR 1 TE 1 FLEX D K 8 bench spots They thought I was a laughing stock of the league, they voted against my son and my 14 year old Guru Grey from helping me but that only fueled my fire and now we are here ladies and gentlemen." Step into the monkey cage and onto the gridiron with Michael Rapaport every week as we dissect the psychological and physical warfare of fantasy football. Come play The Gringo Mandingo every single week on DraftKings.com (PROMO CODE: RAPAPORT) and win real money which having the most fun you can have in fantasy football. Michael is taking on all comers in weekly and year long fantasy football. He's coming for the game and the Howard Stern Fantasy Football League HARD BODY KARATE. This episode is not to be missed! item.title: EP 198 - CHINO MORENO (THE DEFTONES)
item.description: In this Variety Show Episode begins with a solo Gringo Mandingo aka Michael Rapaport on the mic before speaking to a big time fan of the I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST aka Chino Moreno (lead singer of The Deftones). The Dingo opens it up discussing his first Fantasy Football draft of the season and his upcoming draft for The Howard Stern Fantasy Football. The 2016 VMA's are now the HOLD YOUR HEAD AWARDS aka GET YOUR MIND RIGHT AWARDS with his thoughts about Kanye, Shumpert, Beyonce, Britney, Rhianna and Drake. Then Michael calls in Chino Moreno of The Deftones to discuss performing for 25+ years, signing to Madonna's label & meeting her for the first time, best countries for a Stickman, favorite songs to perform on tour and how he started listening to the WORLDWIDE PHENOMENON nearly 2 years ago. The 2015 Co-Host of the Year aka Gerald Moody is dialed in with Michael, to speak on Rudy Giuliani's age, Colin Kaepernick's protest, Black on Black crime, Larry King's love life, the passing of Gene Wilder and a NO GOOD JUDGE. This episode is not to be missed! item.title: EP 197 - CAN A STICKMAN STICK?/NATE DIAZ VAPE GAME/15 DMX KIDS/HARDEN KICKS/2016 KNICKS PREDICTION/SICK F*CKS OTW/DE LA SOUL'S NEW ALBUM/NO GOOD JUDGE
item.description: In today's social media era, Can A Stickman stick? Michael Rapaport is rocking solo before calling in the 2015 Co-Host of the Year and the I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST is on the pulse of the world today. We discuss Usain Bolt's cocksmen status, Nate Diaz vaping post UFC202, DMX has his 15th kid, James Harden's new sneakers, s/o to Dwayne Stafford, Brock Lesnar bugging at SummerSlam, BROOKLINSANITY, Jim Boeheim needs to respectfully mind his business, 2016-17 New York Knicks Prediction, Sick F*cks of the Week, De La Soul & Frank Ocean's new album, Leslie Jones getting hacked, Hope Solo being suspended, Dwight Howard's 8th Baby Mama suing him, Kevin Durant backlash, a tragedy in North Carolina, students having sex with teachers, a No Good Judge, the dangers of online dating, a s/o to The Rapapack and a whole lotta mo'! This episode is not to be missed! We discuss Usain Bolt's cocksmen status, Nate Diaz vaping post UFC202, DMX has his 15th kid, James Harden's new sneakers, s/o to Dwayne Stafford, Brock Lesnar bugging at SummerSlam, BROOKLINSANITY, Jim Boeheim needs to respectfully mind his business, 2016-17 New York Knicks Prediction, Sick F*cks of the Week, De La Soul & Frank Ocean's new album, Leslie Jones getting hacked, Hope Solo being suspended, Dwight Howard's 8th Baby Mama suing him, Kevin Durant backlash, a tragedy in North Carolina, students having sex with teachers, a No Good Judge, the dangers of online dating, a s/o to The Rapapack and a whole lotta mo'! This episode is not to be missed! item.title: EP 195 - BRENDAN SCHAUB
item.description: In this Variety Show Episode that began immediately following UFC 202 with the raw reaction from The Gringo Mandingo aka Michael Rapaport about McGregor vs Diaz. Before calling in an expert on the topic, Michael closes out the 2016 Olympic Summer Games as only he can. Brendan Schaub (Former UFC Heavyweight, contestant on The Ultimate Fighter & co-host of The Fighter and The Kid aka Rapaport and The Fighter) discuss the main event at UFC 202, the McGregor vs Diaz rematch, who McGregor would need to face to make the most money possible and the late, great Kimbo Slice. After that call the I AM RAPAPORT: VARIETY SHOW roles on with Michael taking the baton solo to discuss Fantasy Football in The Howard Stern Show League, Michael recording the opening for WWE Summerslam, 2 I AM RAPAPORT WORLD TOUR dates announced, the Sick F*ck of the Week and a whole lotta mo'. For the next leg of the race, Gerald Moody aka The Black Ed McMahon calls in to discuss our upcoming shows in Las Vegas & Phoenix, a No Good Judge, Bette Midler, White Lives Matter trending on Twitter and Team USA Men's Basketball. In the home stretch Dean Collins aka The Young Shooter calls in to chop it up with Michael and is pressed for a Young Shooter Story that's put an extra skip in his step. This episode is jam packed and not to be missed! item.description: The Olympics are in full swing but Stan Van Gundy had no idea. We hear from the Head Coach of the Detroit Pistons in Rio De Janeiro who is down there for his yearly trip. Then we get into it with The Gringo Mandingo aka Michael Rapaport joined by The Young Shooter aka Dean Collins for his review of War Dogs & Trueey or False follower by The 2015 Podcast Co-Host of the Year aka Gerald Moody being patched in coast to coast with the most. We're discussing All Loafs and All Lives mattering, being skeptical of Ryan Lochte's Robbery Story, Alex Rodriguez taking what he can get, Sick F*cks of the Week, props to T-Sizzle for fixing his furniture, Ray Rice's role out of the NFL, Kendall Jenner's request/where to find asses that pass the test, No Good Judges, Cats Harassing Michael's front lawn and a whole lotta mo'! item.title: EP 190 - FOOTBALL FEVER/DOG BULLYING/D TRUMP BORSCHT BELT/ROD MAN/SICK F*CKS OTW/FIGHTS ON VIDEO/MARY LOU IN '84/PP & PP/MARK FEINSAND OF NYDN ON AROD
item.description: Michael Rapaport comes at you with a Solo Freestyle Friday with the help of some friends called in from the Los Angeles Gloom Tomb. Michael couldn't be more excited for football and fantasy football to get started, especially with the Patriots new QB looking shaky out of the gate. D Trump has drawn his ire and needs to hit the borscht belt with his brand of comedy or take his look to a reality show. Then we get into neighborhood dogs harassing him and Weezy, Dennis Rodman's broken loaf, the Dumb F*ck of the Week, the Sick F*cks of the Week, S/O to Glen, Mary Lou Retton and all the fans who came out to the Platinum Party in Los Angeles. The Young Shooter was late to stop by so Michael calls him in hot before New York Daily News Yankees Reporter Mark Feinsand calls us from Fenway Park to discuss Alex Rodriguez's legacy. This episode is not to be missed! item.title: EP 189 - LIVE FROM MINNEAPOLIS, MINNESOTA! MICHAEL RAPAPORT AND GERALD MOODY - I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST 3 CITY WORLD TOUR
item.description: Michael Rapaport and Gerald Moody are face to face in front of a live studio audience in Minneapolis, Minnesota at the Cedar Cultural Center and they bring it HARD BODY KARATE. Michael and Gerald spent a lot of time in Minneapolis in 1995 while Michael was filming Beautiful Girls and they've got stories to share from set (including Raging Bull vs. Ordinary People) with NO FACTS CHECKED! We then open it up to the crowd to talk Amber Rose, Sick F*cks of the Week, Minnesota Timberwolves Basketball, Minnesota Vikings Football, Great Stickmen (including Prince), filming Higher Learning and a whole lotta mo'! This episode is not to be missed! item.description: Michael Rapaport and Gerald Moody are face to face in the Los Angeles Gloom Tomb to tackle the topics in the world at large as only they can. First we recap our 3 City World Tour and how Gerald is dealing with true fame coming from relative obscurity. Antonio Sabato Jr. your acting career was never popping and G wants your underwear modeling career (Sock not included). We didn't make the news (Besides The Sprewell Interview) but we break the news: George W. Bush dumps on Trump, Michael breaks down the difference between a Sick F*ck and a Dumb F*ck of the Week, where Derek Fisher should play next, LeBron can't chase ghosts, Draymond needs to learn how to use SnapChat, Clint Eastwood you're not actually Dirty Harry, George Zimmerman gets snuffed, Patriots in Hollywood, Dutch Guy who waited 10 days in an airport for his online date is corny, Orlando Bloom is looking for attention, Caitlyn Jenner has no sense of humor, U.S.A. Men's Basketball should play against themselves and a whole lotta mo'! This episode is not to be missed! See you at the Platinum Party! item.title: LIVE SHOWCASE EP 187 - LATRELL SPREWELL
item.description: Former NBA All Star Latrell Sprewell (Warriors, Knicks, T-Wolves) joins Michael Rapaport and Gerald Moody for a LIVE packed house podcast from his hometown Milwaukee, WI at Turner Hall Ball Room for an all time great interview. Latrell discusses first playing organized ball as a senior in High School, how he made it to the NBA the league in the 90's, playing against Michael Jordan, making the All NBA 1st Team in 93-94, Golden State then versus now, the road to the NBA Finals in 1999/playing without Patrick Ewing, NYC during the Platinum Era, being approached by Calvin Klein mid game, Stan Van Gundy/Danny Aiello, T-Wolves 2004 Western Conference Finals vs Lakers, NBA Dress Code, Bald Spree vs Braided Spree, playing against All Time Greats and then we open the floor up to the fans in Milwaukee for questions. This episode is not to be missed! item.title: SHOWCASE EP 186 - ANDY COHEN
item.description: Andy Cohen (Host of Watch What Happens Live on Bravo) joins the 2016 Bravoholic Award Winner Michael Rapaport for an in depth STEREO Podcast about being a host of a stop for A list celebrities, biggest guest, who Andy wants on WWHL but hasn't appeared yet, the current state of America, Top 5 Real Housewives to save the world, What's Next For Andy (Live with Kelly?), his hectic schedule and a whole lotta mo! Then the Unofficial Official Political Correspondent Eli Lake Calls In to break down the DNC, Hate for Hillary, Benghazi, Big Money in Politics, The Implications of a Hack from Russia and how it may tie to Donald Trump. To close it all out we have unaired audio of Danny Aiello at the Democratic National Convention. This episode is not to be missed! item.title: SHOWCASE EP 183 - BRANDON MARSHALL
item.description: In this Showcase Episode Michael Rapaport speaks to Brandon Marshall, Pro Bowl Wide Receiver for the New York Jets about playing in New York, working on Inside the NFL while still playing, Trashtalking, Ryan Fitzpatrick, Fantasy Football, Jay Cutler and Deflategate. Before getting into it Michael goes Solo from the Soundproofed Gloom Tomb. Our hearts go out to those affected by the tragedies in Nice, France and Baton Rouge, Louisiana. First we tackle UFC and Brock Lesnar testing positive for a banned substance, Tom Brady officially being suspended for the first 4 games of the NFL season, The Cross Fit Games Grand Prize, Sick F*cks of the Week, Acclaimed Stickmen and Brandon Simmons gets Aiello'd. This episode is not to be missed! item.description: Make your head not with those FIRE Moody Beats off the top as The Gringo Mandingo aka Michael Rapaport and the Black Ed McMahon aka Gerald Moody are back to take the world(wide phenomenon) by storm! To kick it is off is a story that's a Sick F*ck of the Year Candidate thanks to the Sh*t Bandit on the Upper Beast Side of Money Making Manhattan. Lena Dunham has drawn the ire of Michael for her comments about Kanye West's music video 'Famous' making her feel "unsafe". It's 4th of July Weekend which means don't play with fireworks, take it from JPP & AIELLO. Caitlyn Jenner is on the cover of the Sports Illustrated Where Are They Now? Edition and Michael feels betrayed since we know where she is every day! Mourning Istanbul's attack, All Loafs Matter, Self Driving Cars, A No Good Judge, Stan Van Gundy from the beaches of Greece, NBA Free Agency Bonanzas, Announcing the Platinum Party Date/City, How to Create Hip Hop and a Shout out to Jesse Williams. This episode is not to be missed! item.description: This is a therapeutic podcast! This eclectic episode tackles all the important issues in the WORLD(WIDE PHENOMENON)! Michael Rapaport and Gerald Moody dig into the Derrick Rose's Wig Piece, Buddy Hield's Furniture, Tony Robbins' Coal Walking Instead of Being in the League, Aiello Motivational Speaking and a Sick F*ck of the Week. Then we dive into the Politics of this crazy mixed up world as only they can in layman's terms with our I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST Political Correspondent Eli Lake (BLOOMBERG VIEW) to discuss BREXIT, EU, Scotland potentially leaving the United Kingdom, Boris Johnson, DTRUMP's lack of foreign policy/chances of winning the election, Hilary Clinton, Elizabeth Warren, No Fact Checking, Gun Control, NRA and the D.C. Social Scene. This episode is special from top to bottom and is not to be missed! item.title: EP 175 - NBA DRAFT SNEAKER CHASERS/SOCIAL MEDIA NEW WORLD/SFOTW/PTFD/J.R. IN THE BROWN ROOM/DROSE/MY SOURCES!/LET LEO LIVE/THAT OOWEE/NO GOOD JUDGES
item.description: Coming to you from the backyard of the L.A. Gloom Tomb it's the Malachi Crunch aka Michael Rapaport & Gerald Moody kick it off by offering advice to the newest members of the NBA while citing current and former Knicks as examples of what not to do (we congratulate Malachi Richardson on being drafted #22 by Sacramento). We've got a Sick F*ck of the Week from the Championship parade in The Land (which gives Michael Post Traumatic Finals Disorder Flashbacks) followed by discussing J.R. Smith's lack of wearing a shirt while entering the Brown Room. We speak on the addition of Derrick Rose to the New York Knicks and what the NY media should expect from him. There's another player hater on Leonardo DiCaprio and his cocksman prowess that we have to stick it to, white people that need addressing, No Good Judges to jostle, those that belong in the Cuckoo's Nest and a whole lotta mo! This episode is not to be missed! item.title: EP 174 - THE BET/LEBRON JAMES KOOL AID/LATRELL SPREWELL IN MIL/YULIN DOG EATING FESTIVAL AIELLO/O.J. DOC PT. 4-5/RILEY CURRY/BUILD A ZOO/FAKE ASSES
item.description: The I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST is Certified Platinum and hotter than a heat wave. Michael Rapaport aka the Gringo Mandingo and Gerald Moody aka The Black Ed McMahon are the coast to coast hosts with the most! Michael owns up to losing the NBA Finals bet that him and Gerald aka Co-Hostradamus made but Michael is none too happy that Gerald is "holding LeBron's bags" after being complicit in bashing him for the last 19 months (as chronicled in EP167 aka the LeBron James Bash Extravaganza). Bringing a title to the (Waste)Land but stopping in Las Vegas first with J.R. Smith going buckfool! Michael thinks Warriors put up a good fight and losing this year may be the best thing that could happen to them in the long run. As we enter the DOG DAYS of Summer the I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST is hitting the road July 28-July 31st to perform live shows in Minnesota, Milwaukee and Chicago. RAPAPACK WE NEED YOUR HELP! Our dream guest for Milwaukee is Latrell Sprewell LIVE and we need to create a hysteria to make this happen. Danny Aiello stops by to discuss the Sick F*cks in China at the Yulin Dog Eating Festival and Michael becomes defensive of Weezy. We're discussing O.J. Made In America Parts 4 & 5 aka Bizarro O.J.Land, a different Riley Curry getting sent death threats via the mail, National Selfie Day, preachy Vegans, being a race non-conforming individual and a famous fake ass. This episode is not to be missed! item.title: EP 172 - BIZARRO CURRY ON THE BURNER/BACK TO OAKLAND FOR GAME 7/SVP/I AM RAPAPORT TOUR/O.J. DOC PT. 1-3/NO GOOD JUDGE/DTRUMP/SFOTW/ADULT BABY SYNDROME
item.description: This is not a podcast, this is a way of life. The I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST is coming in hot after Game 6 in Cleveland went to the Cavaliers and Stephen Curry went full Bizarro, throwing his mouthpiece into the front row. Michael is Team Warriors and Gerald is Team Cavs. It's going to take Game 7 to settle their bet on the 4 Train. The Gruesome Twosome then get into the episode HOT. They're discussing the podcast getting so much love on SporstCenter by Scott Van Pelt (who has an open invitation to the Gloom Tomb), the I AM RAPAPORT TOUR hitting the Midwest (July 27-31 in Minnesota, Milwaukee & Chicago), Gerald being thoroughly embarrassed by this crazy person O.J. Simpson aka The Great American Sambo because of O.J. Made In America 30 For 30, another No Good Judge, a prediction about D TRUMP from G MOODY, a Sick F*ck of the Week that involves Adult Baby Syndrome and Michael gets Bizarro Curry's Burner phone number as he wonders the streets of Cleveland. Shout it to the Rapapack! This episode is not to be missed! item.title: LEGACY EP 171 - TRAGEDY IN ORLANDO/SFOTW/ALI TRIBUTE/"TRANSCENDING RACE"/I'M O.J./LEBRON THE SNITCH/TONY AWARDS/GMONETI'S ACTOR WORKSHOP/DE NIRO LOTW
item.description: Our deepest thoughts, sympathies and condolences go out to all of those affected by the shocking events that took place in Orlando at Pulse Nightclub. We are all in this together. Getting into it Michael Rapaport aka The Gringo Mandingo, Mr. White Folks, Bird, etc. and Gerald Moody aka the Black Ed McMahon have strong feelings about Lieutenant Governor Dan Patrick of Texas (SFOTW), the Muhammad Ali Tribute, "Transcending Race", the Honorable Elijah Muhammad, the Nation of Islam, O.J. Made In America, Denouncing Black Culture, Draymond Green's Suspension for Game 5 of the NBA Finals, LeBron James aka LeBron James aka The Snitch, Live Tour Dates Being Announced, The Tony Awards, Meg Ryan, Theater Talent, Multiple Races Winning Awards, What Constitutes Great Acting, GoodFellas Robert DeNiro Line of the Week Dedicated to LeBron James aka the Henry Hill of the NBA. This episode is not to be missed! item.title: EP 169 - ROD STRICKLAND
item.description: Michael Rapaport speaks with former NBA Point Guard Rod Strickland (Knicks, Spurs, Blazers, Bullets/Wizards, Spurs, Nets, Heat, etc.) & Assistant Head Coach at USF. Michael used to watch him play in NYC as a teenager and is excited to talk one of his all time favorite basketball players. Low key off the court but dynamic on the court and on the podcast! They discuss how he ended up connecting then coaching with John Callapari, Phife Dawg comparing his his rap personality to Rod Strickland (the underdog), being Kyrie Irving's Godfather (how his game evolved and how good his father was at basketball), the Culture of Basketball in NYC, his Favorite NBA Teams to play on, players he loved playing with and wishing it worked out with Mark Jackson on the New York Knicks. This episode in the I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST SIGNATURE SERIES is not to be missed!

item.description: Since August 2014, the I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST aka THE WORLDWIDE PHENOMENON has been presenting you a multitude of topics HARD BODY KARATE without fact checking. We LOVE the National Basketball Association and discuss it in many of our episodes. It's biggest star for the past decade is LeBron James has been caught in the crosshairs of The Gringo Mandingo aka Michael Rapaport for a multitude of reasons. With respect Michael chats with the likes of Brian Scalabrine, Wood Harris, Duncan, Gerald Moody and Bizarro Steph Curry on the subject of The King including his ups and downs, his antics and actions on/off the court, The Good, The Bad and Why Do You Shave Your Armpit Hair? LeBron James Bash Extravaganza extends through One Return to The Land, Two Regular Seasons, Two Head Coaches, One Feature Film, One Finals Matchup Versus Golden and more. Will the king be dethroned? item.title: DISPLACED EP 163 - WE THE 6/SECRET HANDSHAKES/ALL LOAFS MATTER/BILLBOARD AWARDS BASH/TOM BRADY'S APPEAL/OKLAHOMA LAWMAKERS/SFOTW/SURFER KANYE ON ELLEN
item.description: Coming to you from parts unknown it's Michael Rapaport aka The Gringo Mandingo and Gerald Moody aka The Black Ed McMahon. They're both displaced from their homes but that can't stop/won't stop them from dropping bombs. Michael is all hopped up on Chocolate and a Cavs loss to get things fired up. Michael is so excited for the 6 while wondering what happened to Clevelnd's secret handshakes after a loss. One thing is for certain in the two Conference Finals in the NBA... ALL LOAFS MATTER. Draymond Green is lucky not to be suspended, Dahntay Jones with his Sucka Sh*t, the son of a Platinum Era Stickman and Steve Kerr's lack of lips are all up against The Firing Squad. If anyone knows how to play Dirty on the hardwood (No Bruno) it's Michael Rapaport. After NBA talk we enter into the Billboard Music Awards world because Rock N' Roll is Fininto, ladies making Michael blush and Madonna's singing voice need to be addressed. People who need to step aside for good : Tom Brady, Oklahoma Lawmakers who want to impeach President Obama and the Staten Island Sick F*ck of the Week. Ellen losing control, Kris Jenner looking to cash in and Operation Good Time. This episode is not to be missed! For Soft Ass T's please visit us at www.districtlines.com/iamrapaport Show love! item.description: ALL LOAFS MATTER! Michael Rapaport & Gerald Moody will not stand for this most recent aggression against all loafs everywhere. Michael's Juliette Lewis Documentary "Hard Lovin' Woman" premieres at the Tribeca Film Festival Friday April 15th, 2016 and we couldn't be more excited! Not just for the film but to hang out with the legend himself, Robert DeNiro (and sneak selfless). We've been watching I AM CAIT and we have to discuss because we're over the politically correct BS. Stan Van Gundy has lead the Detroit Pistons to the playoffs and we've got the exclusive post game interview. Prognosticating the future of the Knicks surrounding rumors of Phil Jackson's departure. The Sick F*ck of the Week. Michael admits that he's a fan of Lena Dunham's "Girls" but they've got more ideas on filming in Brownsville, Brooklyn. Acknowledging the Rapapack, Frisbeeing Self Driving Google Cars, Standing Up For Presidential Candidates, Relationship advice from Khloe K and fearing #40 on the Spurs. This episode has it all and is not to be missed! Congratulations on a legendary career Kobe 'Bean' Bryant! item.title: HIP HOP EP 142 - TALIB KWELI LIVE FROM THE TUNEIN RADIO STUDIOS/CAPPADONNA FROM THE WU TANG CLAN CALLS IN/HAPPY BIRTHDAY DJ PREMIERE and LARGE PROFESSOR
item.description: The Albino Rhino and the Black Ed McMahon are back and on that boom bap shit! In this very special episode, the fellas give praise to two of the most prolific hip hop producers of all time, DJ Premiere and Large Professor. Next, Talib Kweli stops by the TuneIn studios in Austin Texas for an amazing sit down interview. They're talking twitter and social media, Sean Price, Mos Def, favorite albums, the making of "Get By", working with Kanye West, marching in Ferguson with the Black Lives Matter protests, D Trump, Bernie Sanders and more. After that, Cappadonna from the Wu Tang Clan calls in to discuss everything Wu Tang, current projects, and if there will ever be a Wu Tang biopic made. This action packed, all hip hop everything episode is not to be missed! In this hysterical interview they talk public access TV in Canada, The Tom Green Show, battling executives, Tom's influences in TV, skateboarding, Hip-Hop and at 16 making a music video in Brownsville, Brooklyn. Of course the Bum Bum song, Road Trip, Freddy Got Fingered, Eminem referencing Tom in "The Real Slim Shady", guest hosting The David Letterman Show, the fake wedding with then fiancee Drew Barrymore on Saturday Night Live and watching Charlie's Angels with Prince Charles. item.title: URGENCY EP 130 - HIP HOP AT THE GRAMMY'S/THE LIFE OF PABLO/FAMOUS WHITE PERSON WITH NO LIPS/<3 KENDRICK LAMAR + STEVIE WONDER/ENDORSING BERNIE SANDERS
item.description: I AM RAPAPORT is made for the people. The plan was to release our interview with Tom Green but The Grammy's has Michael Rapaport out of his cage and on the mic. Michael is disappointed by the lack of care for Hip Hop ("The last form of original music") and those who passed at The Grammy's (RIP Sean Price). Taylor Swift and her crew were looking to set it off. Why is Kanye West still talking about her anyways? Michael bought Life of Pablo and breaks down his initial feelings about it after listening to it through 3x. Yes, Michael buys music. He does not support downloading music and does not support that most of the All Time greats have to tour until the wheels come off because they don't make enough money. Shout outs to Alice Cooper, Kendrick Lamar, Stevie Wonder, Michael's public endorsement of Bernie Sanders for President of The United States of America and more. This episode is not to be missed! Pre-Order Soft Ass T's are now available for purchase. The "Jake", "G-Moneti" & "Black, Green & Red Black History Month Logo". OFFICIAL I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST shirts are available here: http://www.districtlines.com/iamrapaport Check out the feature film Comedy A Stand Up Guy. In Theaters, iTunes & On Demand NOW! Starring Bob Saget, Ethan Suplee, Danny A. Abeckaser, & your fearless leader Michael Rapaport. Full Movie Here on iTunes: https://itun.es/us/N02iab #AStandUpGuy

item.title: EP 129 - ARIAN FOSTER
item.description: All Pro Running Back Arian Foster of the Houston Texans joins Michael Rapaport in the Los Angeles Gloom Tomb for an open conversation that's as real as you'll hear from a star NFL player. This interview is a must listen for any football fan or those who would like to know more about the behind the scenes of a professional athlete. Touching on topics such as the Super Bowl, overcoming injuries, players retiring early, the media, religion, diet, player behavior on and off the field and more. This episode is not to be missed! Ain't No Fact Checking! This episode is not to be missed!

He has won over a million dollars in a single week playing fantasy football (really!) and has been giving a watchful eye over Rapaport's DeLight aka A History of Violence aka There Will Be Blood in the Howard Stern Fantasy Football League. item.description: Michael Rapaport is back in Los Angeles, coming to you LIVE from the VROOM TOMB (Credit: The Rapapack) aka Michael's sh*t box SUV and you're in for a treat! First of all, Happy Chanukah to our Jewish fans (see Amazon list below for gift suggestions) as we kick off the holiday season with delight. Michael is elated after sweeping Fantasy Football NFL Sunday in the Emotional Friends League. Not only did he defeat Howard Stern Show Producer Gary Dell'abate and earn a first round bye in the playoffs next week but he won a $5,000 bet vs. ESPN Fantasy Football Guru Matthew Berry that he needs to donate to charity. Rapaport's Delight has won the war! Michael has a bone to pick with the NY Daily News, Mad Shaming, iPhone elbow, an actor friend who thinks Kanye West (and his sneakers) has been more impactful on music than Stevie Wonder (and his compassionate wig piece). There is good in the world to be talked about too! Michael's upcoming Juliette Lewis documentary, The BeatNuts Record of the Week and hero Doctors who are giving wounded warriors a new loaf on life. This episode is not to be missed! BEHRINGER PODCASTUDIO USB Numark iDJ Live DJ Controller for iPad, iPhone or iPod Touch (30-pin)

item.title: EP 103 - ADDRESSING TERROR/PC POLICE HUNT FOR "AMERICA'S NEXT GREAT RACIST"/AZIZ ANSARI/MAD SHAMING/RONDA ROUSEY/JOE ROGAN/WIGGA PLEASE/NBA WIG PIECE
item.description: Michael is back in the mobile gloom tomb, driving, podcasting and ranting around Los Angeles. First we take a moment to recognize those afflicted by terror worldwide. Our thoughts, prayers and feelings go out to you. We hope this episode brings you joy. Michael has some thoughts on how to deal with anyone worldwide who avoids eye contact, talks greasy, has bad breath or doesn't comply with instructions while. Then we turn it up to 450 because recently @MichaelRapaport was a part of a witch hunt on Twitter over his comments about Aziz Ansari sounding white. Just like Rosie Perez sounds Puerto Rican, Danny Aiello sounds Italian and Mark Wahlberg sounds like an Irish dude from South Boston. Michael stands by his comments and brings the thunder about this event, offering $1,000 cash to any fake wannabe analysts that want to come at him or the I AM RAPAPORT podcast talking greasy. Those who hid behind fake names and avatars but want to pop off anonymously are and need to be dealt with. We are doing a #StopTheMadShamingWalk2016. Mad is the opposite of happy and it's OK to be mad. You Mad Bro? Yes! Stop the mad shaming! Ronda Rousey has to be discussed. She's never been hit in the mouth and got exposed. Joe Rogan has an open invitation to come on the podcast and Michael wants to go on JLE to discuss with him. If a movie called "White Men Can't Jump" came out today would people be offended? If you see Michael on the streets and want a Soft Ass T, let him know! If you want to donate to Gerald's home/Gloom Tomb in the Boogie Down Bronx then you can donate to below. Once we hit the the goal we are going to have a party at the BX GLOOM TOMB. Gerald calls in to talk about that, WIGGA PLEASE, NBA WIG PIECE'S & TOM BRADY. This episode is not to be missed!

item.description: Today's podcast is GROUNDBREAKING. In the pilot episode Michael said "I can record this podcast from anywhere, I can be doing it from my car!" Today he fulfills that prophecy and takes you on his day in Los Angeles on the way to the doctor to get a physical. It's wild on the streets and in the world and Michael has a clear mind about it all with takes on Knicks coach Derek Fisher vs. Matt Barnes, Kanye choosing fashion as a higher art form than hip hop, his television watching habits, story time with Steven Spielberg and all that is BEFORE chopping it up with G MONETI. Kick back and roll your window down because this WORLDWIDE PHENOMENON is not to be missed! If you're reading this then hit us @iamrapaport, @MichaelRapaport & @GeraldMoody1560 on Twitter & @iamrapaportpodcast, @MichaelRapaport & @gmoneti on Instagram with #CARCAST.

item.description: Michael and Gerald open up with a conversation about to NYC Hip Hop Legend Sean Price who passed away. We then get into it. The fellas are coming in HOT this episode! "Political parties have reached out to the I AM RAPAPORT podcast for our support because of our influence." Which ones? We don't fact check. "This is a non fact checking podcast." Michael is offended by foreign comedians coming to America and hosting late night talk shows only to slap America in the face. He wonders if there's any American hosts, a guy from NYC perhaps who's in England and talks sh*t about the king. Michael can't wait for you all to see him as Charlie Bullman on Edward Burns/Steven Spielberg's Public Morals, August 25th on TNT. Gerald asks about acting and it leads to a story about when Michael knew he was ready and how it got him his role in ZebraHead. Hint: White Men Can't Jump.

item.title: EP 67 - Bill Burr (Comedian/Actor/Podcaster - PART 1: LOVE
item.description: Michael is in the West Coast Gloom Tomb with the lone red rabid wolf, comedian Bill Burr. They first met making the movie "The Heat" with Sandra Bullock & Melissa McCarthy and are collecting their $42 residual checks to this day. They talk Bill's stand up comedy mentality, how he gets better, what he's working on for his act and what he's learned from other great comedians. Michael and Bill still love working on and watching movies but Michael doesn't f*ck with comic book movies (even though he'd be in one). Since Michael has done so many movies Bill wants to know if Michael knows if a movie is going to be bad when he gets to set. Michael has a special story about a film with a big name star that he did that he calls "a piece of sh*t" and why it was a f*cking disaster. The gloves start to come off in this one! This episode is not to be missed! Stay tuned for BILL BURR - PART 2: WAR.

item.title: EP 64 - AL PACINO LOTW/MICHAEL AND G MOODY TALK 80s NYC HIP HOP CLUBS/MAKING BEAUTIFUL GIRLS/EARLY ADVENTURES IN L.A./RICKY SCHRODER IN 1986
item.description: Michael and Gerald are coming to you from the Gloom Tomb and they're not f*cking around. They talk current events. Michael and Gerald recount sneaking down courtside next to George Gervin to see Year 2 Michael Jordan play at MSG. 25 year old Gerald and Michael going to Minnesota to make Beautiful Girls. While there they would go nuts at Prince's Disco with white women and NBA players. There's a special J.R. Rider story to be told. 15 year old Michael and Gerald were going Hip Hop Clubs in NYC during the 1980's and got to see the top artists perfuming but fights would break out constantly. Gerald was always looking out for Michael who was told not to wander off. G Moody recounts the first time he came to L.A. to visit Michael and how they'd go to the Improv to see the hottest new comics. Growing up with former NBA player and Brooklyn legend Kenny Anderson, taking a joy ride around L.A. in a "borrowed" Trans Am and a run in with the cops that included eggs and Ricky Shroeder.

item.title: EP 63 - Matt McGorry (Actor)
item.description: Michael Rapaport sits down with a co-star from his upcoming TV show, TNT's Public Morals Matt McGorry (Orange Is the New Black and How To Get Away with Murder). These two thespians discuss Matt's rise to fame from personal trainer/body builder to part time actor to star on two hit TV series'. Michael has all kinds of questions for Matt especially when it comes to working on set with so many women and which cast members Matt would want to live on a stranded island with. Michael talks about being on Friends and Fresh Prince of Bel Air and cashing those $.17 residual checks. Matt speaks on the difference between a network show and a Netflix show, people's reactions to him on the street, Feminism, Caitlyn Jenner, most impressive actor's he's worked with and how much of a stickman he is (one who's willing to repopulate the planet if he has to), jail mail and the upstate NY escaped murderers. This episode is NOT TO BE MISSED!

He introduces them to terms that they're going to need to get used to now that marriage is legal in all 50 states. Michael lauds Pres. Obama for going out on his shield as his presidency nears an end and for saying "the N-Word" on Marc Maron's WTF Podcast. Michael has strong feelings about letting people continue to fly their confederate flags and Donald F*cking Trump running for President. Our Famous White People Who Don't Have Lips is back! It's not a derogatory thing, it's just a fact. Even though we don't fact check. The large loaf murders case has reached its conclusion. Michael goes through it but is distracted about Snapple choosing Bravo TV's Andy Cohen over him for commercials. Michael then drops a CAN'T MISS, "WIGGA PLEASE". Sending best wishes to Dustin Diamond, Shouting out to France, Soft Ass T Talk & a Kardashian National Holiday. This episode is NOT TO BE MISSED!

item.title: EP 60 - DEFINING MOMENTS OF THE NBA SEASON/J.R. SMITH'S SCOOTER/DANNY AIELLO/LEBRON JAMES IN A MOVIE/RAY RAY/MICHAEL & G MOODY'S HISTORY PART 1
item.description: Michael and Gerald are coming to you live from the West Coast Gloom Tomb to discuss the defining moments of the NBA season. Michael thinks that the youth of the NBA is taking over for better or for worse. For worse would be J.R. Smith bringing a scooter to Game 6 to the NBA Finals. Michael and Gerald GO IN on LeBron James for claiming to be a great leader/best player in the world and allowing J.R. to behave like this. They recount what would've happened if J.R. was on the Lakers, Celtics, Sixers, Bulls teams of the 80's/90's. Danny Aiello and Chris Broussard chime in. Michael takes aim at LeBron James' acting in the new Judd Apatow movie 'Trainwreck'. One more thing on Rachel Dolezal being light skinned and the difference that makes in the black community. The L.A. Tour with Gerald rolls on and he airs his frustrations about people coming up to Michael and pitching things to him on the streets. Part 1 of the HISTORY of how Michael & G Moneti met and their adventures together.

Brian is playing, Michael is the a coach along with the third member of THE BIG RED 3 Matt Bonner. Michael is the "Psychological Evaluator". This is an episode you do not want to miss!

Finally Michael brings up if it would be ok for him and/or others to be have racial reassignment surgery if they felt it's what they always wanted. Buckle in for an episode that can't stop and won't stop!

item.title: EP 38 - DE LA SOUL FOOD/BOOM BAP/HIPSTER PRICKS WITH SELFIE STICKS
item.description: Michael & G Moody are passionate people. Especially when it comes to Hip Hop. Right off the bat De La Soul is discussed because they are still going strong decades later. How they influenced Tribe Called Quest and others. Groups that have broken up are brought up. Michael says De La Soul is to Hip Hop as Red Hot Chili Peppers are to Modern Rock. Michael loves the story of De La Soul and offers to make a documentary about them. Then the fireworks begin... SUBJECT: THE LOST ART OF BEAT MAKING. BRING BACK BOOM BAP. Michael doesn't want to see Hip Hop going down the road of Rock N' Roll in the 80's with hair bands. Michael implores Jay-Z, Kanye West, Pharell and Eminem to keep sampling records and even suggests that he should be an overseer of an album for the ages. Hipster Pricks with Selfie Sticks. Michael's Danny Aiello Impression. Sh*t Bags and the art of not picking up after your dog by Michael and the art of stopping dogs all together from G Moody's special concoction.

item.description: Michael and G Moody are coming to you from the New York Studio and are off and cracking (with no fact checking). Michael wants YOU the listeners to help pick a middle name for Gerald. Let us know what you think. We talk signature terms such as loaf, sugar dicking and your F style is buckwild. Michael is INCENSED about Marshawn Lynch's behavior, deflated balls, Bruce Jenners Loaf, John Calipari's cheating ways and Justin Bieber admitting he is fake. item.title: EP 20 - WHEN FANS ATTACK
item.description: Michael and G Monetti are back with the thunder. After sitting together courtside at Madison Square Garden for a Knicks game Michael gets confronted by a perturbed fan who didn't agree with Episode 17's conversation about celebrities adopting black babies as accoutrement. Little did the fan know that G Monetti was right there ready to come strong to defend their viewpoint. The Bill Russell conversation is declared dead, racism needing to be discussed is discussed, Stuart Scott is remembered for bringing the hip hop culture to sports, Michael wants to make a documentary on Channel J is, Ugly George is discussed, Robin Byrd is invited onto the podcast for an interview, Al Goldstein is remembered for for cursing out Bill Cosby in 1984, Howard Stern and the fantasy football league is brought up including Matthew Berry not respecting Michael as "a player", the Rapaport family ski trip is brought up and G Moody is not having all these old ass actors playing the lead in action movies anymore.
